p: Estimates for all examined behaviours tend to be low, with the exception of recycling, which reaches a medium effect size ( d = −0.457 95% CI −0.595, −0.319 POB 32.3%). Interventions promoting a reduction in energy consumption also have an expected POB of 6.6% ( d = −0.094 95% CI −0.133, −0.055). Within the category of energy studies, we included studies targeting the purchase of energy-efficient appliances. The impact of interventions to specifically influence these purchases is estimated with precision ( I 2 = 22.6% ns) as only marginally significant ( d = −0.036 95% CI −0.129, 0.058), with an estimated POB of 2.5%.
